name: BrookLodge & Wells Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel it self is very nice set in lovely surroundings, and is well finished. although its a little isolated out in the middle of the country side. We arrived and got settled in before going to look where we were going to eat that evening. There were two choices the strawberry tree which offered an expensive set price menu or actons pub which we were told offered pub food, as we had ate in a wonderful restaraunt the night before in Dublin we thought we would prefer a more pub food menu so we headed to actons.
reviews.title: Awful food!! terrible service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The menu had several selections I chose chicken satey and my wife chose a beef dish, what we had not realised was that these were basically pre made dishes in trays which were then heated up in the microwave there was no choice of rice or chips just a pototo salad or pasta mix. Basically if it couldn't be microwaved they didn't seem to have it! and there were no lights just candels so we could hardly make out what we were eating - the meal was awful and nothing like we would have expected. It felt like if you didn't go for the expensive meal in the strawberry tree they didn't really care about you and offered you a terrible alternative.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

likes.disliked: — Service, bed, shower and lack of value for money

reviews.title: We just love it!
reviews.text: the rooms were comfortable although a little tatty and worn looking.

the breakfast the next morning was another dissapointment we were seated and placed our order and were then forgotten about while others who were seated long after us were being served, we asked several times about our order and eventually got our food with no appology and to add salt to the wound they got the order wrong anyway!
reviews.title: Dissapointed Wedding Guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all in all we felt like the hotel looked great but did not deliver the so called 4 star standard really poor food and really poor service.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

reviews.text: My family and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Brooklodge Hotel for a family wedding. I have mixed thoughts about the place.The location is great.
reviews.title: mixed thoughts on the Brooklodge Hotel

reviews.text: Firstly we booked a family room about 4 months ago and were expecting and prepared to pay for a large suite. We were given a very small dark room with one double, one single and a small camp bed. All the beds were literally pushed up together and it was totally impossible for 4 people to stay there. The heat was stifling and the bathroom really old fashioned and horrible.None of us slept that first night.
reviews.title: Great l.ocation - pls upgrade the staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next day we changed rooms to a mezzanine suite which was lovely and way more suitable for a family of four and it was only 70 euro extra per night !
reviews.title: relaxing ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we went back to our original room to get our bags, it had been cleaned for the new occupant but one of our old used towels had been left thrown on the back of the chair.
reviews.title: Still the best on the East Coast

likes.liked: — The chilled out atsmosphere and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a dinner reservation for 17 people in the Strawberry Tree for 7pm. On our arrival, we were ignored by staff for about 10 minutes. The restaurant staff were quite unfriendly although the staff in all other parts of the hotel were friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Rubbish, would not stay here again

reviews.text: Was really looking forward to my stay at Brook Lodge having read so many rave reviews. Booked in July 2007 and the earliest Saturday Night I could get two single rooms was October 20th 2007. Arrived and the setting and place was beautiful, room was very nice and comfortable. As I had not booked treaments at the Spa was refused entry to the swimming pool in the hotel and was abvised to use another swimming pool in the complex for wedding guests.
reviews.title: Avoid this place like the plague

reviews.text: The reson for my stay at Brook Lodge was to eat at their restaurant. This is where the trip went downhill very fast. The eating experience was a disaster and to be avoided at all costs in the future. We were seated at a small table for two in the front of the restaurant at a window but ajoining the main enterance to the kitchen. Staff kicked the door as a means to gain enterance to the kitchen. Humourous at first but a headach after a couple of hundred kicks. I though my seating arrangements were bad until I caught a glimps of the rear part of the restaurant which can only be described as a school canteen. I would have refused to sit there.
reviews.title: Appalling service

likes.disliked: — Appalling service in restaurant for both dinner and breakfast

reviews.text: The food in what is billed as "Ireland's Only fully organic restaurant" was ok. (The term used by the hotel owner). But I hadn't travelled to Brook Lodge for ok food. The vegtable of the evening was carrots. No other vegtable was available. The service from top down was a joke. Very few but certainly overworked staff. They need a Union. At the bar after dinner I was informed that I would have to wait 20 minutes for service as the barman was on his own. To his credit when I asked him to ring management to get extra staff to deal with a full bar, he did and suitable replacements arrived.
reviews.title: reality check

likes.liked: — setting ,building, decor. big fan of slightly faded country elegance
likes.disliked: — service food and lack of attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at Breakfast to join the Q for 35 minutes. Again I asked the duty manager to get more staff so we could be at least seated and given coffee. It took a further 25 minutes for this to happen. The Q turned into an interesting event for guests to swap stories of how bad their experience at the hotel. Nobody was happy and all vowed not to return. One elderly couple had tried to complain but was not listen to. Another wedding guest spoke of the poor quality of food at the reception. "Brown stuff with glup" was his discription of the main course.
reviews.title: Great place for R&R

likes.liked: — THe space in the room and the home entertainment system

reviews.title: Too many kids for a Spa resort!
reviews.text: I spoke to the owner at checkout. Like the elderly couple I was heard but not listened too. He was not interested in the complaints. Yes Breakfast was a disaster but he blamed in on not enough people ordering breakfast in bed!!!! Surely he should have known that in advance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to secure 1 night on the Sunday of the bank holiday weekend for a quick break. We were allocated a room which was in the new building and had been furnished with pieces that were totally out of character and scattered about the roomlike an obstacle course. Dinner was good , though a tad overpriced at 60 euros a head. We were rushed through our courses and asked to take coffee outside so they could have another sitting at our table. We did so but found this at the price to be a bit Irish!!
reviews.title: Overpriced imitation 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We retired to the bar to get our coffees and had ordered a bottle of red wine to be sent from the restaurant, both failed to materialise!! We asked then about our coffees and wine and got the coffees thrown at us. 30 minutes later still no wine so we left the Bar. Back in the bedroom(of a 4 star Hotel) , a 4 foot sleigh bed for 2, 4 channel Tv, remote with no batteries, Tea and Coffee with no biscuits, No breakfast in Bed menu, No slip mat or protection in bathtub, Stained carpets,Noisy and no comment card. By 4 am both of us were still awake and wishing the morning to come quickly so we could leave.
reviews.title: absolute paradise-please ignore the bad reviews!

likes.liked: — pure luxury in a stunning location

reviews.text: On check in, I was asked if I would like a newspaper for the morning which i said yes. On check out they asked me if I had got my paper, which I hadn't. They then gave me one and "oh, Just one minute until I add that to your Bill" In all my years of travelling and staying with Mandarin oriental,leading hotels of the world, Relais & Chateau etc , I have never come across such audacity as to charge a newspaper to your bill. We left and we won't be back, and if you have sense you will overlook this hotel. They need a wake up call!!
reviews.title: Great getaway for relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well what can I say-my fiance and I have been visiting the Brooklodge since 2003 and plan to have our wedding there in 2009. It is the most sensational hotel we have ever stayed in, it has an excellent reputation and some of the reviews on this site are in our oppinion, so far off the mark. I do understand that the Brooklodge try to attract a certain clientele-thus its pricey enough, as are most high class hotels, If one doesnt want to pay for excellent service and surroundings then why should they receive it? In my oppinion you definately get what you pay for here. We try to get to Macreddin Village at least twice a year and every stay we've had has been nothing but divine! We would HIGHLY reccommend it for a romantic getaway to recharge those batteries! Just remember to bring your credit card! :)
reviews.title: Lost a tiny bit of personal touch but still a brilliant getaway

likes.disliked: — no bar food this time, hope its just temporary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been going to Brook Lodge for several years now and despite a couple of minor glitches along the way I've always thoroughly enjoyed the stay. I was a bit aprehensive this time round, having read the reviews, but am please to say that it again lived up to my expectations. The food and service was excellent and the only downside initially was our room. My husband had booked a suite as a treat, but when we saw it we were both disappointed. Because it is built as a Mezzanine style, you don't get the sense of space that you expect from a suite. As such, we asked whether we could downgrade our room to a Junior Suite. While there were none available, we were offered a very spacious Superior room and our room rate was changed without us having to ask. We will definitely continue to go back - if for nothing else the food in the Strawberry tree!
reviews.title: No longer our favourite- never again

likes.liked: — They do good food, but its pretentious and way overpriced
likes.disliked: — Cramped rooms, shabby furnishings, deplorable service

description: 5 Reasons you must visit The BrookLodge & Wells Spa:1. We are a unique hotel in a unique village that offers guests an all-in-one opportunity to experience an Ireland that blends the best of old and new. Culinary Hotel of the Year 2013, Hotel of the Year ‘09 & ’10, and Business Hotel of the Year 2012, The BrookLodge & Wells Spa features an assortment of superb accommodation from classic country house style bedrooms through to state-of-the-art mezzanine suites.2. An extraordinary organic & wild food ethos means that Macreddin Village boasts the only certified Wild & Organic restaurant in Ireland - The Strawberry Tree. Another restaurant, a village café, a dining lounge, a country pub and an organic bakery and smokehouse complete a matchless collection3. An exceptional set of leisure facilities includes a fabulous Resort Standard Spa, Macreddin Golf Course - designed by Irish Ryder Cup Hero, Paul McGinley, an equestrian centre, mapped walks and complimentary bicycles.4. Macreddin Village has a history dating back to the 5th Century, and is situated in a "Designated Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty", a remote Wicklow Valley, yet just an hour's drive from Dublin. Surrounded by stunning countryside, our near neighbours include the world renowned beauty spot - Glendalough Monastic Settlement and Lakes, and The Wicklow Way - Ireland's premier mountain walking trail.5. Now is the time to avail of the lowest hotel rates in Western Europe, and visit Ireland, And nowhere offers a more rewarding and distinctive Irish experience than The BrookLodge and Macreddin Village.
